snippet: The $1.1 trillion measure makes some tax breaks permanent, increasing the deficit by $500 billion, and it surpasses previous spending limits by $66 billion.
abstract: Congressional negotiators introduces spending and tax-break package with $66 billion in new spending for 2016 which adds over $500 trillion to the deficit; Republicans and Democrats cooperate to present numerous tax breaks and revisions; specific details of package described.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Robert Pear, Jennifer Steinhauer, Sabrina Tavernise, Eric Lipton, Emmarie Huetteman and Gardiner Harris.

lead_paragraph: The $1.1 trillion measure makes some tax breaks permanent, increasing the deficit by $500 billion, and it surpasses previous spending limits by $66 billion.

headline.main: Budget Deal Raises Spending, and the Deficit, Through Tax Breaks
headline.print_headline: Spending, and the Deficit, to Go Up in Budget Deal
